trial_identification.studytitle: Improving anxiety assessment and management in people with cognitive impairment and dementia: Validation of an informant measure and pilot testing of a multi-component behavioural intervention.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: In cognitively impaired patients, is a 12-week multi-component behavioural intervention effective in the treatment of anxiety.

interventions.interventions: This is a pilot study of a 12 week multi-component behavioural intervention for people with dementia with clinically significant anxiety. The behavioural intervention will engage both the person with dementia and an unpaid caregiver. Components will include psychoeducation, anxiety monitoring, relaxation training, activity scheduling, and a sleep intervention. The sleep intervention will provide participants with techniques to improve night-time sleep. The focus will be on helping family members to better manage anxiety and associated behaviours. The program will be conducted by trained personnel. The sessions will be weekly and each session will last approximately 40 minutes.
interventions.comparator: The comparator for this study will involve 12 weekly sessions lasting approximately 40 minutes each. The sessions will be conducted by trained personnal and will involve discussion of neutral photographs. This program has been designed to control for therapist time and attention without providing any specific anti-anxiety effect.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Feasibility of study will be assessed through compliance with the protocol.
% of patients with GAI anxiety score <10

secondaryOutcome.outcome: % of patients with improved IQAD scores
% of patients showing improved QOL-AD scores

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: patients of RBWH memory clinic with cognitive impairment and significant anxiety symptoms informant who has regular contact with participant able to understand english at least 60 years of age
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: patients without cognitive impairment patients without significant anxiety symptoms patients without suitable informant patients non-fluent in english under the age of 60

trial_design.concealment: Opaque envelopes containing the group allocation will be used to allocate participants to one of the two groups. An independent person will prepare the envelopes.
trial_design.sequence: An independent person will obtain a randomization code from the following website: http://www.graphpad.com/quickcalcs/randomize1.cfm.
trial_design.designfeatures: Pilot study to determine protocol feasibility
